head.note: This manuscript record does not have associated contents as it is likely a composite manuscript. See the corresonding parts for a listing of its contents.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 4 distinct parts:

head.note: This manuscript contains: Choral Services for the principal festivals of the whole year, consisting ofܩ̈ܠܐ, ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ, ܒ̈ܥܘܬܐ, etc., ascribed toEphraimandJacob. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 17 items. N.B., items have been renumbered by the editors and may not reflect Wright's original numeration.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Choral Services for the principal festivals of the whole year, consisting ofܩ̈ܠܐ, ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ, ܒ̈ܥܘܬܐ, etc., ascribed toEphraimandJacob.
The Commemoration of the blessed Virgin
Part of the Epiphany
msItem.author: Ephraim
msItem.title: Part of the Epiphany
msItem.note: Fol. 36 b has been designedly left blank by the scribe.

msItem.title: The Commemoration ofS. John the Baptist
Part of the Commemoration ofS. John the Baptist
Part of the Commemoration ofS. John the Baptist
Part of the Presentation in the Temple
Part of the Presentation in the Temple

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 8 3/4 in. by 5 5/8, consisting of 144 leaves, some of which are much stained and torn, especially foll. 43, 134, and 141— 144. The quires, signed with letters, are at present only 15 in number. The first six quires, the eighth, and several at the end of the volume, are altogether lost; and leaves are missing after foll. 1, 2, 3, 4, 14 and 22. There are from 19 to 24 lines in each page. This volume is palimpsest throughout, comprising parts of three manuscripts (see Add. 14,512 foll. 67-124, lower text , Add. 14,512, foll. 36-66 and 125-144, lower text , and Add. 14,512, foll. 1-35, lower text ).

collation.p: The quires, signed with letters, are at present only 15 in number. The first six quires, the eighth, and several at the end of the volume, are altogether lost; and leaves are missing afterfoll. 1, 2, 3, 4, 14 and 22.

item.p: Some are stained and torn, especiallyfoll. 43, 134, and 141— 144.

layout.p: There are from 19 to 24 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: This volume, which is palimpsest throughout, is written in a good, regular hand of the Xth century.

origin.origDate: This volume, which is palimpsest throughout, is written in a good, regular hand of the Xth century.

head.note: This manuscript contains: The book of Isaiah, according to the Peshitta version. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items. N.B., items have been renumbered by the editors and may not reflect Wright's original numeration.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: The book of Isaiah, according to the Peshitta version
msItem.note: The running titleܐܫܥܝܐis still clearly visible onfoll. 74 a, 83 a, 94 a, 96 a, 102 a, 103 a, at the foot; and on foll.75 a, 84 b, 100 b, 108 b, 113 b, 122 b, and 124 a, at the top. The text is most distinctly legible onfoll. 69 and 72, the latter of which contains ch. xvi.1— xvii.2, and the former, ch. xvii.2—xviii. 3.

physDesc.p: Vellum leaves, about 8 3/4 in. by 5 5/8, written in two columns. These leaves are palimpsest (see Add. 14,512, upper text ).

item.p: The text is most distinctly legible onfoll. 69 and 72, the latter of which contains ch. xvi.1— xvii.2, and the former, ch. xvii.2—xviii. 3.

layout.p: The manuscript is written in two columns.

handNote.desc: . A manuscript of the book of Isaiah, according to the Peshitta version, written in two columns, in a fine Estrangela of the vith or viith cent.

origin.origPlace: This manuscript is written in a fine Estrangela of the vith or viith cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Jacob of Batnae. Probably discourses of Jacob of Batnae. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items. N.B., items have been renumbered by the editors and may not reflect Wright's original numeration.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.author: Jacob of Batnae
msItem.title: Probably discourses of Jacob of Batnae
msItem.note: It appears to contain discourses of Jacob of Batnae, but enough of the text has not been deciphered to make this quite certain.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.
